page.title: 01Description of Colne Valley
page.content: The deep broad valley of the river Colne runs diagonally across the area.The stepped valley sides provide for farms with dairy herds and sheep. Settlement in the area is of four types. The old cottages and farms of the hilltops date from before the industrial revolution, while the small towns of Slaithwaite and Milnsbridge grew up with the expansion of textiles and contain many mills and terraced housing.Council estates were built in Cowlersley and Golcar, and in recent years there has been much private house building in Linthwaite, Golcar and around Scapegoat Hill. Many of the woollen mills are empty following the decline in the textile industry, but there are smaller manufacturing units, chemical and engineering works in the valley.
